content.label: I love it. Fully functional, fast-paced, good mechanics and aesthetics; the perfect appeal to both the gamer and the music lover in me. Only thing I could ask for would be the option to use playlists in Survival and Boss Rush.

title.label: Great game but no Pandora/Spotify sync ability

content.label: This is a game worth paying for if you have music on your device.  I say this because at the moment it does not sync with Pandora or Spotify which is a shame.  I would rate higher if this was added because it would have unlimited life span when it comes to music and replay ability.  At the moment I mute it and listen to pandora,  with the same outcome because it plays the four or five songs it comes with.  I can see this getting old faster than if it did sync.  Great game,great effects, and it is fun.  Only downside is you need music on your device, 3/5 stars rated.

title.label: Best music game out on iOS

content.label: I discovered this game when I had Just a iPod using it with all my music was just an awesome experience I definitely recommend this game if you're a music lover a have time to kill try it out üòéüòéüòéüôèüèø

I have been playing this game for years, and I have loved it for that time. But I love it EVEN MORE now that I figured out that you can stream your game to your Apple TV! It is responsive and feels like your device just becomes a controller! I love it!
The only thing I wish this game had was more enemies. Other than that, no complaints here.

title.label: Fun w/music‚ÄîWish it was on AppleTV

content.label:
I have logged tons of hours on this game because it let‚Äôs me multitask: I can listen to music I love (thousand of songs from my library is synced) & the game gets progressively harder. If theirs 1 way it could be better is if there was an AppleTV version (w/gamepad support) that pulled from a connected iTunes library. If there was another it would be pulling from playlists in iTunes.

Other than those 2, there‚Äôs now much room for improvement.
I use to own this game on my Xbox 360 which was awesomen because at the time you could only download music on to the 360 but now I can play this on my phone which is awesome!!!!
Still love this app but it wont play my music, also they should a add a restore purchases button somewhere
Love it
I really enjoy this game, but could you guys update it to work with Apple Music?
I have always loved this game but I spent money on it for my iPhone to find out it doesn't even play my iTunes music. But I can listen to German techno radio? Yeah not cool.

title.label: Great Integration of Your Music into the Game

content.label:
I got this years ago,& still enjoy the concept of using your own local music to drive your ship‚Äôs power. I wish it was on the new AppleTV (with Gamepad highly recommended) because its control scheme is a dual stick 1-move/2-shoot like Robotron. The warnings about seizures seem responsible because the screen fills with flashing in sync to you chosen track.

If you don‚Äôt have local music (read from the Music library you access via the iOS Music app) then you won‚Äôt have the best experience. So sync up your favorite tracks at the very least & enjoy. Still 5-stars & 6 if they made it for AppleTV :)
This game is so good and it was worth every penny get it now!

I have played this game on my 360,my PS3, iPod touch 3rd and 4th gen and now my iPhone 6plus. I absolutely love this game but am saddened to see that it does not support Apple Music. When I boot up the app it shows that it is reading my iTunes library but when I go to select a song that I have downloaded via Appel music, I cannot locate any... I would of thought that by now the 2 would work hand I hand and it only makes sense that both Apple Music and beat hazard would work that way.  But, I am only able to play songs that I have actually payed for, and I find this very disappointing... I would love to see this patched at some point in the near future and I'm sure that many others would as well.
I love this game. You will too, depending on your genre of music and skill to maneuver your fingers right (:
I love this app but please update it to be usable with Apple Music.
Kids love this app.  Works good, even on my old iPhone 4s.  There should be a separate section in the AppStore for Apple TV apps.

Love that I can play my music and the game and have them work in harmony together! Gameplay can be intense or relaxing, which suits people's moods very well. The only thing I'd like to see added is more bosses and a sort of warning system so you can be prepared for the boss you will face. A boss index would be good to give you a few pointers, but other than that a sweet game. Would recommend to people without epilepsy for sure!
I've absolutely enjoyed this game in the past. Everything about it is fantastic but now with Apple Music coming out the game doesn't seem to see any iTunes music at all.

This game says you can play with your own music but it refuses to list any of the songs I own. They're downloaded to my iPhone, the game says it scanned my ~4000 songs, but then it doesn't display any of them. The app support link just takes you to the website, and the FAQ found there is completely unhelpful. Uninstalling and steering clear of this company in the future.
Just as respectable as the PC version, but please add Apple Music support soon; where we can play the songs that we've downloaded to our library via Apple Music in-game.
Never gets old I have got this game on my Xbox, pc, iPad and now the iPhone 6+ and wow amazing visually and controls are solid..
Need a restore purchase, that is quite bull. I bought gold ship a long while back. No five star for you.
I'm not great at giving praise, but this game is awesome! It's a roller coaster ride from relaxing to nerve racking. I especially love one stick for when I have other things to do.

This game is really good. I like playing it and the challenge included in it (by challenge I mean how long you can spin and shoot) but I got an in app purchase and there is no restore option. I would like that to be there since I just got the new iPhone. Hopefully they can install one. I'm giving this a four until they push and update. It would get a 5 if it had a restore button.

I don't even know how to explain how awesome this app is besides that it's worth the pay. The song tracks, the cool effects, etc are what games like this should always be like and stay like. I would give this app 6 stars if I couldüëç
I honestly love this game. The visuals are beautiful and the game can get really intense. It's a great way to listen to music too.

This game is just awesome. There are really no words to describe it. Metal Heads will LOVE this game. The more intense your music is the more intense the gameplay is. The effects are simply stunning and the way the game responds to the music is just amazing. The best $7 I ever spent in the App Store. If your music library is lame, the game will be lame. That's the only possible reason you could give this game a bad rating. \m/

title.label: Where have you been all my life!??

content.label: What makes this game extremely enjoyable is the combination of music and action play. Just.... WOW really.
I love this game , it's definitely for people who love music and gaming ^_^
Super fun and easy!! üòä

Was üåüüåüüåüüåüüåüüåüüåüüåüüåüüåüten stars but...Ive had this game for ever was ranked elite paid for the gold ship and unlocked all perks..... Spent$$$ had to delete it bought better iPod touch 5 64g reinstalled it and all the stuff i bought gone along with my rank which took forever. No restore purchases button and wants me to repurchase everything?!! I think not!!üò§ so contacted developer an haven't  heard back yet and if it gets fixed then ill change my rating until then no stars.

I've loved this game every since I've gist purchased it and started playing it to my favorite tracks. The only issue I see with it now is the fact that it needs an update for iPhone 6/6 Plus. I'm sure many other people are feeling this way. This is the ONLY thing keeping me from giving this a 5 star right now. Hopefully it happens sooner than later‚Ä¶ üòÅ
Very fun an addicting

The game itself is very good. I like being able to listen to my own music. But there are downsides such as no restore purchases for in-app purchases, no playlist selection, and a lot of bugs. This game will be worth the money after some updates.

title.label: Best Arcade Style Game For IPad

content.label: This is by far the most addicting arcade style game available. The game play is enhanced by the beats per minute and intensity of your own music selection. Try the free version to get an idea, the paid version comes with many more weapons and perks.
This game rocks! My eyes are bleeding! :)

Overall a pretty fun game; it makes listening to music more enjoyable. I would recommend. I love the variety of tracks it can be played to, as well as how the ship firing and enemy ship movements are controlled by the energy of a song.

How the enemies appear make less sense. I wish there was some sort of list describing the various enemies and what makes them appear, or more information available on what exactly the triggers that spawn enemies and control their actions are. That would make gameplay much more interesting by allowing players to predict and prepare for what is coming up, and would make the visualization of the music more enjoyable and effective by understanding what components of the music the players are seeing as enemies appear.

Additional modes for different kinds of music, different visualizer modes, perhaps, would also make gameplay more diverse and interesting and would keep me more interested in the game.

title.label: Pretty dang fun, and a bit of a challenge! :)

content.label:
I never really thought that video games could be powered by music. That is, until I picked up this crazy-awesome shooter! Fun. Hectic. Addicting. Although, bear in mind that I do NOT recommend this to anyone who is prone to epileptic seizures and/or is sensitive to flashing lights (all for health and safety precautions, of course), because this game has a boatload of those (which can thankfully be toned up to a maximum of 200% intensity, or down to the users' preference). And, might I add, these lights add to the action of this game. The more intense your music gets, be it metal, good old R&R, or heavy dubstep (I recommend xKore and Liquid Stranger), the more intense the gameplay becomes, and it may even cause a boss to appear on occasion.
So, all in all, this is a game that I will not likely be removing from my phone (or computer) anytime soon.
Honestly it's better on console.
It's a great game that ties your music into the game! Love it.

title.label: Most fun I can have with the music I listen to

content.label: Better than the original I played awhile back. This one is spot on with the shooter genre. Playing this game with the music I enjoy makes it an awesome combination!

Game is so good I bought it twice. Bought it 3 years ago for PS3 then bought it a couple years ago for my phone. Absolutely tons of fun and every single song in your library is a different level. Even a live version of a song produces a different level than the studio version of the same song. Great, well made game. Only complaint is the On-Screen Sticks.. Like any game using the control scheme it can be difficult to perform dodging maneuvers but otherwise a well done game

I fire now speak later
Got to extant!

Honestly, the most non-zombie related fun I've had on my phone. Plug in the headphones (or not, whichever you prefer) and let the awesomeness of your music translate into explosions and lasers. This game is basically the visual and aural expression of ADHD, and it's incredible. So much fun!
I got the game on PC first and it really lives up to the expectation.
This is one of the best games on the app storeüòÉ There are no other games like it!!!!!!!
Great concept and incredible seizure causing effects

I can't tell you how much I love this game, I first played it on my PC and found it quite by accident.  I ignored it for weeks before I finally clicked on it and OMGukkie!!!!   Holy wow!!!  I loved it.  I showed it to my daughter and niece and they love it.   Awesome graphics and the visualizer that accompanies your music is so mesmerizing.  It doesn't crash like other apps I have played and its affordable for the in app purchases.  I totally recommend beat hazard! Rockin game!
Great shooting game, almost perfect if weren't for the music arrangement. I should be able to find a song easily such as not having to go to a song in the middle of A and B. A must buy.
Awesome!!!!
